page.title: 04Farming in Barkestone
page.content: The sort of animals farmers keep now are cows pigs hens and sheep.Most hens are now kept in batteries but they used to be able to run around.Not all hens are kept in batteries some are kept in large buildings called litter houses as the floor is covered with straw or shavings.The hens can not get out but they can roam about inside them.Hens are used for their eggs and meat and sheep are kept for their wool and meat.A lot of sheep together are called a flock and once or twice a year they have to be dipped to keep away diseases and they have to sheared once a year in around May or July because they would be too hot.Pigs are kept for their meat and cows are kept for meat and milk.
